data.title: Check whether findNearestPoly actually did find a poly
data.body: Fixes issue #530 by checking `startRef` and `endRef` after the calls to `findNearestPoly`. Now if NavPath fails to find a path you'll get a warning in the console as usual.

data.title: NavPath may fail to find path with no error
ITickable supports object deletion
data.body: This is a reworking of https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/436 to support object deletion of processTick() and advanceTime().

data.title: SceneCullingState with culling and camera frustum
data.body:
- Fix for issue https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/525  This fix takes into account the skewed view into the world when you have a projection offset and the ability to see further into the scene at the edges opposite to the offset.
- SceneCullingState now has two frustum rather than one: a culling frustum and camera frustum.
- The camera frustum should be referenced when you need the projection matrix or don't want a skewed frustum.
- The culling frustum should be referenced during any scene culling or when determining what dynamic geometry to render.  It currently skews itself to take into account any projection offset (automatically calculated in SceneCullingState constructor).
- When there is no projection offset, the camera frustum and culling frustum are the same.  This usually means any time when not using the Oculus Rift.

data.title: Ground cover banks with camera
data.body: Place a GroundCover object in the scene (use the defaultTree_fronds_material material).  As the camera banks (such as with the Rift) notice that the individual pieces will also bank.

data.title: Fix for RectF::intersectTriangle()
data.body: Reported in this issue: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/512

data.title: Over Agressive Culling Frustum with Rift
data.body:
While using the Rift, the culling frustum currently culls too aggressively.  Small objects that are near the edge of view can pop in and out while still visible.

I believe this has to do with the offset projection used for the left and right eyes.  This offset extends the view beyond a regular frustum and causes the popping.  Extending the culling frustum to take into account the projection offsets will hopefully correct it.

data.title: Fix for DTS Vertex Paint and 2nd UV with LODs
data.body:
Fix came from https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/230

Only the first suggested fix in Bank's thread was applied.  The suggested fixes further in the thread appear to be within an if() block that would only execute for older DTS shapes (version < 23) that could never have a 2nd UV set or vertex paint.

Original thread: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/130594

data.title: Fix TSMesh::castRay() and small collision mesh
data.body: This is the fix outlined in https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/485

data.title: Revert Player Buoyancy Change
data.body: This reverts the change made by https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/490  It actually goes further and comments out the Player's buoyancy calculation rather than just the change in velocity.

data.title: Underwater Fixes
data.body:
- Caustics now respects the passed in water plane rather than assume that the water plane is on the XY plane.  This allows for caustics to work for steep rivers.
- Fixed lerp() warning in underwaterFogP.hlsl.
- Cleaned up turbulence and caustics PostEffect scripts to remove unused items.
- Caustics are now enabled and disabled based on the control object being underwater, just like turbulence.  Moved this code to fog.cs to be with the underwater postFX.

data.title: Default value for WaterFogData plane distance
data.body: Set the default WaterFogData plane distance to be the same as global bounds.  This solves an issue with the connection's control object mistakenly thinking it is under a water plane when there are no water objects in the scene.

data.title: Turbulence respects viewport and projection offset
data.body:
- PostEffect class now offers the current projection offset and target viewport as shader constants.
- Turbulence postFX now takes the current projection offset into account.
- Turbulence postFX now clamps itself to the current viewport.
- Turbulence postFX now renders after the glow bin, specifically after the glow postFX renders.  This ensures that it can take advantage of knowing the current viewport rather than affecting the entire render target.

data.title: Update pxMultiActor.cpp (fixed)
data.body:
Fixed PhysX compile issue on VS2010 ("'FS' : is not a class or namespace name")

In reference to http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/135499

data.title: Update pxMultiActor.cpp
data.body:
Fixed PhysX compile issue on VS2010 ("'FS' : is not a class or namespace name")

In reference to http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/135499

data.title: Update ReflectionManager on Scene Field Change
data.body:
During side-by-side rendering the refraction texture needs to be updated
for both the left and right fields.  These changes add a new GFXDevice
event type to track when a field is about to be rendered.  The
ReflectionManager listens to this new event and ensures that the
refraction texture will be updated if it is referenced by a material.

data.title: Blinn-Phong Specular Changes
data.body:
Based on the work done here:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/21032

data.title: No .EXE files were produced
data.body:
Not for sure if it was something I did wrong but no .exe files were produced.
Theirs not  one in the full and empty templates.

data.title: Managed Particle Location Fix
data.body: Corrects the filepath for the managed ParticleFX data that onServerCreated() looks for in the Empty Template.

data.title: RectF::intersectTriangle() -- wrong parameter for testing.
data.body: Reported here:  http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/135438

data.title: Vector parse order within Trigger::castRay is inconsistent
data.body: Solution will be to use the fix from improperly submitted pull request #340

data.title: Removing a duplicate CorrectMuzzleVector initPersistFields() entry.
Initialize mCameraRotation to (0, 0, 0).
data.body: Fix for issue #507

data.title: GuiObjectView does not initialize mCameraRotation
data.body: Lack of a default results in garbage values for CameraRotation which can cause the viewed object to be set to a random rotation.  Solution will be to initialize mCameraRotation with a logical value (0, 0, 0).

data.title: Frustum Comparison Fix
data.body:
- Frustum comparison now includes comparing the projection offset.
- Fixes objects that only set the projection matrix if the frustum has
  changed during side-by-side rendering, such as the WaterPlane.

data.title: PlaneReflector Support for Side-by-Side Rendering
data.body:
- The PlaneReflector class now supports side-by-side rendering.  This
  does mean that while in this rendering style that all planar reflections
  are rendered twice, as reflection is a screen space effect from the eye
  point of view.
- Planar reflections now work in the Oculus Rift.
- Modified GuiTSCtrl::onRender() to move up where the rendering style is
  defined to just before the reflection manager has its turn.

data.title: Expand PostFX Viewport Options
data.body:
- Added an option for a postFX to get its viewport from a named texture
  in slot 0, if there is one.  This allows the postFX to operate when the
  named input texture's viewport is different than the current viewport.
- Modified the SSAO postFX to use the new
  PFXTargetViewport_NamedInTexture0 option to more closely link SSAO with
  the prepass buffer.
- Modifed the GFX method setActiveRenderTarget() with a new parameter
  that indicates if the current viewport should be modified with the new
  rendering target.  This defaults to true to maintain its previous
  behaviour.  The postFX rendering pipeline sets this to false as it now
  handles its own viewport setup, and removes an unnecessary
  GFX->setViewport() call.

data.title: Viewport fix for PostFX and SSAO
data.body:
- General fix for PostFX render targets to properly support the GFX
  viewport setting.  This is an opt-in change through the use of the new
  mTargetViewport property as most PostFX run fine with their assumption
  of the viewport being the whole rendering target.
- The SSAO PostFX has been modified to use the new mTargetViewport
  property.  This allows correct rendering in a side-by-side view such as
  with the Oculus Rift, or any other constrained viewport rendering.

data.title: Viewport Fix for Glow PostFX
data.body:
- Modified the glow postFX to now respect the current viewport settings.
- This fixes glow rendering for the Oculus Rift and any other time the
  glow rendering should be limited to a region of the back buffer.
